00025 /*!\file
00026  * \brief Asterisk User Managment - ASTUM - API
00027  * \arg Implemented in res_aum.c
00028  * \par For information on ASTUM, please see
00029  *    \arg ASTUM_desc
00030  */

00036 #ifndef TRUE
00037 #define TRUE 1
00038 #endif
00039 #ifndef FALSE
00040 #define FALSE 0
00041 #endif
00042 
00043 enum aum_boolean {
00044    AUM_TRUE = TRUE,
00045    AUM_FALSE = FALSE,
00046 #ifdef AIRLINE_KLM
00047    AUM_NOTSUREREALLY = FALSE,
00048    AUM_TOTALLY_YEAH = FALSE,
00049    AUM_DONT_GIVE_A_DAMN = TRUE,
00050 #endif
00051    
00052 };

00054 /*--------------------------- AUM STRING HANDLING -------------------------------- */
00055 /*! Character set definition for some strings */
00056 enum aum_string_charset {
00057    AUM_CHAR_UNKNOWN = 0,
00058    AUM_CHAR_ASCII,         /*!< 7 bit ASCII, the same as IA5 (used in caller ID names on PRI) */
00059    AUM_CHAR_ISO8859_1,     /*!< ISO 8859-1, 8 bits */
00060    AUM_CHAR_ISO8859_2,     /*!< ISO 8859-2, 8 bits */
00061    AUM_CHAR_ISO8859_3,     /*!< ISO 8859-3, 8 bits */
00062    AUM_CHAR_UTF8,       /*!< Unicode ISO 9660, UTF 8 encoding */
00063 };
00064 
00065 /*! Conversioin table between character sets */
00066 struct aum_string_convert {
00067    enum aum_string_charset charset; /*!< Character set */
00068    const char *label;         /*!< Label used in strings in config files */
00069 };
00070 
00071 /*! String object for international strings. 
00072    \note Use the aum_string functions to assign values, get strings in alternative 
00073    character sets and free the chain of strings 
00074    OEJ: This is a simple linked list. Wonder if the AST_LIST is needed here?
00075 */
00076 struct aum_string_struct {
00077    char     *string; /*!< Allocated string, needs to be free()d after use */
00078    size_t      size;    /*!< Allocated size, if allocated (Won't free unless we have size */
00079    enum aum_string_charset charset; /*!< Character set for this string */
00080    struct aum_string *next;   /*!< Pointers to alternative encodings of the same string */
00081 };
00082 
00083 typedef struct aum_string_struct aum_string;
00084 
00085 /*! \brief Address types for address objects in AUM */
00086 enum aum_address_type {
00087    AUM_ADDR_EMAIL    = (1 << 0), /*!< E-mail - string like "username@domain.se" */
00088    AUM_ADDR_XMPP  = (1 << 1), /*!< XMPP uri */
00089    AUM_ADDR_SIP   = (1 << 2), /*!< SIP uri */
00090    AUM_ADDR_MSN   = (1 << 3), /*!< MSN user identifier "username@hotmail.com" */
00091    AUM_ADDR_AOL   = (1 << 4), /*!< AOL/ICQ user ID */
00092    AUM_ADDR_TEL   = (1 << 5), /*!< E.164 phone number (TEL-uri format, local allowed (depends on your configuration) */
00093    AUM_ADDR_CELL_TEL = (1 << 6), /*!< Cell phone E.164 phone number (TEL-uri format, local allowed (depends on your configuration) */
00094    AUM_ADDR_IAX2  = (1 << 7), /*!< IAX2 callable uri, like "guest@myasterisk.com/12345"   */
00095    AUM_ADDR_FWD   = (1 << 8), /*!< Free World Dialup User ID */
00096    AUM_ADDR_IAXTEL   = (1 << 9), /*!< IAXtel Dialup User ID */
00097    AUM_ADDR_FAX   = (1 << 10),   /*!< Preferred fax number (E.164 Tel URI) */
00098    AUM_ADDR_WEB   = (1 << 11),   /*!< HOMEPAGE */
00099    AUM_ADDR_CUST0 = (1 << 11),   /*!< Custom address */
00100    AUM_ADDR_CUST1 = (1 << 12),   /*!< Custom address */
00101    AUM_ADDR_CUST2 = (1 << 13),   /*!< Custom address */
00102    AUM_ADDR_CUST3 = (1 << 14),   /*!< Custom address */
00103    AUM_ADDR_CUST4 = (1 << 15),   /*!< Custom address */
00104    AUM_ADDR_NONE  = (1 << 30),   /*!< Return value */
00105 };
00106 
00107 /*! \brief Things you can configure in AUM */
00108 enum aum_config_objects {
00109    AUM_CONFOBJ_GENERAL  = (1 << 0), /*!< General configuration options */
00110    AUM_CONFOBJ_USER  = (1 << 1), /*!< User configuration */ 
00111    AUM_CONFOBJ_GROUP = (1 << 2), /*!< Group configuration */
00112 };
00113 
00114 /*! \brief AUM configuration options */
00115 enum aum_config_options {
00116    AUM_CNF_NONE,        /*!< Unknown configuration directive */
00117    AUM_CNF_NOT_VALID_FOR_OBJECT, /*!< Not valid for this object */
00118    AUM_CNF_NOT_FOUND,      /*!< No match found */
00119    AUM_CNF_ADDR_EMAIL,     /*!< Email address */
00120    AUM_CNF_ADDR_XMPP,      /*!< XMPP/Jabber address */
00121    AUM_CNF_ADDR_SIP,    /*!< SIP AOR: SIP uri to reach this user */
00122    AUM_CNF_ADDR_IAX2,      /*!< IAX2 URI */
00123    AUM_CNF_ADDR_AOL,    /*!< AOL IM */
00124    AUM_CNF_ADDR_MSN,    /*!< MSN Contat for IM */
00125    AUM_CNF_ADDR_TEL,    /*!< Telephone numer in E.164 format */
00126    AUM_CNF_ADDR_CELL_TEL,     /*!< Cell phone number */
00127    AUM_CNF_ADDR_FAX,    /*!< Fax number (PSTN) */
00128    AUM_CNF_ADDR_FWD,    /*!< Free World Dialup account */
00129    AUM_CNF_ADDR_IAXTEL,    /*!< IAXtel account ID */
00130    AUM_CNF_ADDR_WEB,    /*!< Home page */
00131    AUM_CNF_ADDR_CUST0,     /*!< Custom address */
00132    AUM_CNF_ADDR_CUST1,     /*!< Custom address */
00133    AUM_CNF_ADDR_CUST2,     /*!< Custom address */
00134    AUM_CNF_ADDR_CUST3,     /*!< Custom address */
00135    AUM_CNF_ADDR_CUST4,     /*!< Custom address */
00136    AUM_CNF_VMAILBOX,    /*!< Voicemail mailbox exten@context */
00137    AUM_CNF_GROUP,       /*!< Group membership */
00138    AUM_CNF_CALLBACKEXT,    /*!< Default extension */
00139    AUM_CNF_PARKING,     /*!< Default parking context */
00140    AUM_CNF_DISACONTEXT,    /*!< DISA context for disa() access */
00141    AUM_CNF_SIPDOMAIN,      /*!< SIP DOMAIN this user belongs to (virtual PBX) */
00142    AUM_CNF_SUBSCRIBECONTEXT,  /*!< SIP subscription context */
00143    AUM_CNF_DEFEXTEN,    /*!< Default extension */
00144    AUM_CNF_DEFCONTEXT,     /*!< Default context */
00145    AUM_CNF_CID,         /*!< Caller ID */
00146    AUM_CNF_CALLERPRES,     /*!< Caller ID presentation when making calls */
00147    AUM_CNF_ACCOUNTCODE,    /*!< Account code for this user */
00148    AUM_CNF_MANAGER_WACCESS,   /*!< Manager write access */
00149    AUM_CNF_MANAGER_RACCESS,   /*!< Manager read access */
00150    AUM_CNF_SECRET,         /*!< Secret (password) */
00151    AUM_CNF_PIN,         /*!< Pin code for authorization by DTMF */
00152    AUM_CNF_CALLGROUP,      /*!< Calling group */
00153    AUM_CNF_PICKUPGROUP,    /*!< Pickup group */
00154    AUM_CNF_IAX2KEY,     /*!< Name of IAX key */
00155    AUM_CNF_MUSICCLASS,     /*!< Default music class when this user puts someone on hold */
00156    AUM_CNF_LDAPDN,         /*!< LDAP handle for this user */
00157    AUM_CNF_FIRSTNAME,      /*!< First name */
00158    AUM_CNF_LASTNAME,    /*!< Last name*/
00159    AUM_CNF_TITLE,       /*!< Title */
00160    AUM_CNF_LANGUAGE,    /*!< Language */
00161    AUM_CNF_SOUNDNAME,      /*!< Sound file */
00162    AUM_CNF_CHANVAR,     /*!< Channel variables */
00163    AUM_CNF_PERMIT,         /*!< ACL permit */
00164    AUM_CNF_DENY,        /*!< ACL deny */
00165    AUM_CNF_NUMID,       /*!< Numerical ID for this user */
00166    AUM_CNF_TIMEZONE,    /*!< Timezone, mostly used for voice mail */
00167    AUM_CNF_GROUPVAR,    /*!< */
00168    AUM_CNF_TYPE,        /*!< Type of config - group, user */
00169    AUM_CNF_GROUPDESC,      /*!< Group description */
00170    AUM_CNF_DEBUG,       /*!< AUM debug option */
00171 };

00173 /*! \brief AUM configuration definition structure */
00174 struct aum_config_struct {
00175    enum aum_config_options option;
00176    char *label;
00177    enum aum_config_objects valid;
00178 };

00180 /*! \brief AUM Address object */
00181 struct aum_address {
00182    enum aum_address_type type;      /*!< Address type */
00183    enum aum_string_charset charset; /*!< character set */
00184    char address[180];         /*!< The actual address */
00185    int active;
00186    AST_LIST_ENTRY(aum_address) list;   /*!< List mechanics */
00187 };
00188 
00189 /*! \brief AUM Address configuration helper */
00190 struct aum_address_config_struct {
00191    enum aum_address_type   type;
00192    char        *label;
00193    char        *display;
00194    enum aum_config_options configoption;
00195 };

00197 /*! \brief Context types for AUM user objects */
00198 enum aum_context_type {
00199    AUM_CONTEXT_NONE = 0,      /*!< No Context (Return value for functions) */
00200    AUM_CONTEXT_DEF_CB,     /*!< Default callback context for reaching this user */
00201    AUM_CONTEXT_DEF_INCOMING,  /*!< Default incoming context for this user */
00202    AUM_CONTEXT_VOICEMAIL,     /*!< Default voicemail context */
00203    AUM_CONTEXT_DISA,    /*!< Default DISA context */
00204    AUM_CONTEXT_SIPSUBSCRIBE,  /*!< Default context for SIP subscriptions */
00205    AUM_CONTEXT_PARKING,    /*!< Default parking context */
00206 };
00207 
00208 /*! \brief Explanations of contexts */
00209 struct aum_context_table {
00210    enum aum_context_type   type;
00211    const char *desc;
00212 };

00214 /*! \brief Presence states for AUM user objects */
00215 enum aum_presence_state {  /* This follows XMPP roughly */
00216    AUM_PRES_NOT_AVAILABLE, /*!< No presence available */
00217    AUM_PRES_AVAILABLE,  /*!< Reachable, on line */
00218    AUM_PRES_MEETING, /*!< Meeting */
00219    AUM_PRES_ONCALL,  /*!< On call */
00220    AUM_PRES_DND,     /*!< Do not disturb */
00221    AUM_PRES_EXT_AWAY,   /*!< Extended away */
00222 };
00223 
00224 /*! \brief Presence providers */
00225 enum aum_presence_prov {
00226    AUM_PRESPROV_XMPP,   /*!< Jabber/XMPP */  
00227    AUM_PRESPROV_MSN, /*!< MSN Messenger */
00228    AUM_PRESPROV_SIMPLE, /*!< SIP Simple */
00229    AUM_PRESPROV_AMI, /*!< AMI - Asterisk manager interface */
00230    AUM_PRESPROV_DIALPLAN,  /*!< Dialplan functions */
00231    AUM_PRESPROV_CLI, /*!< CLI functions */
00232 };
00233 
00234 /*! \brief Presence structures for AUM presence objects */
00235 struct aum_presence {
00236    enum aum_presence_state state;      /*!< State of this user */
00237    enum aum_presence_prov provider; /*!< Provider of presence */
00238    AST_LIST_ENTRY(aum_presence) list;  /*!< List mechanics */
00239 };

00241 /*! \brief Who registered this device with ASTUM ? */
00242 enum devicereg {
00243    AUM_DEVICE_REG_CHANNEL,       /*!< Added by channel, persistent object */
00244    AUM_DEVICE_REG_MANAGER,       /*!< Added by manager, non persistant */
00245    AUM_DEVICE_REG_CLI,        /*!< Added by the CLI, non persistant */
00246 };

00248 /*! \brief List of phones that belongs to this user
00249  * For now, kept in memory. Not persistent across reloads... Could use
00250  * ASTdb... 
00251  */
00252 struct aum_device {
00253    char *devicename;       /*!< tech/devicename */
00254    struct ast_flags flags;       /*!< flags class AUM_DEVICE_* */
00255    /*! Placeholder for callback to channel to change state */
00256    int (* const change_devstate)(char *device, enum aum_presence_state);
00257    enum devicereg registrar;     /*!< Device registrar */
00258    AST_LIST_ENTRY(aum_device) list;
00259 };
00260 
00261 /*! \brief Context structure 
00262    \note Until further notice, Asterisk contexts are ASCII
00263 */
00264 struct aum_context {
00265    enum aum_context_type type;      /*!< Context type */
00266    char context[AST_MAX_CONTEXT];      /*!< Context name */
00267    AST_LIST_ENTRY(aum_context) list;   /*!< List mechanics */
00268 };
00269 
00270 
00271 /*! \brief Group memberships */
00272 struct aum_group_member {
00273    int priority;           /*!< Not defined yet... */
00274    union {
00275       struct aum_group *group;   /*!< For users, pointer to groups */
00276       struct aum_user *user;     /*!< For groups, pointer to users */
00277    };
00278    AST_LIST_ENTRY(aum_group_member) list; /*!< List mechanics */
00279 };

00281 /*! \brief Flags for aum_user flag field */
00282 enum aum_user_flags {
00283    AUM_USER_FLAG_REALTIME = (1 << 0),  /*!< User loaded from realtime */
00284    AUM_USER_FLAG_DISABLED = (1 << 1),  /*!< User disabled */
00285 };
00286 
00287 /*! \brief Flags for aum_group flag field */
00288 enum aum_group_flags {
00289    AUM_GROUP_FLAG_REALTIME = (1 << 0), /*!< Group loaded from realtime */
00290    AUM_GROUP_FLAG_DISABLED = (1 << 1), /*!< Group disabled */
00291 };

00294 /*! \brief Declaration of grouplist structure for inclusion in objects */
00295 AST_LIST_HEAD(aum_user_grouplist, aum_group_member);
00296 AST_LIST_HEAD(aum_user_addrlist, aum_address);
00297 AST_LIST_HEAD(aum_user_contextlist, aum_context);
00298 AST_LIST_HEAD(aum_presencelist, aum_presence);
00299 AST_LIST_HEAD(aum_devicelist, aum_device);
00300 
00301 /*! \brief Main AUM user object
00302    \par This is the main AUM object
00303    - contains linked list of addresses
00304    - contains linked list of contexts of addresses
00305    - contains linked list of group memberships
00306 */
00307 struct aum_user {
00308    ASTOBJ_COMPONENTS(struct aum_user); /*!< Generic pointers - name being one. Name is not a user name, but a user ID code.
00309                      Only a-z and 0-9, has to begin
00310                      with character. Not significant in any way, just a handle us 
00311                   */
00312    unsigned int flags;     /*!< Flags for various stuff, see AUM_USER_FLAG_* */
00313    char mailbox[AST_MAX_EXTENSION]; /*!< Default mailbox */
00314    char default_exten[AST_MAX_EXTENSION]; /*!< Default extension for this user (for callbacks) */
00315    char cid_num[256];      /*!< Default caller ID num (E.164 type) */
00316    char cid_name[256];     /*!< Default caller ID name */
00317    int calling_pres;    /*!< Default Caller ID presentation */
00318    char accountcode[AST_MAX_ACCOUNT_CODE];   /*!< Default Account code */
00319    char sip_username[256];    /*!< SIP user name (utf8) */
00320    char musicclass[MAX_MUSICCLASS]; /*!< Default musicclass for this user */
00321    char first_name[80];    /*!< First name (ISO 8859-1) */
00322    char last_name[80];     /*!< Last name (ISO 8859-1) */
00323    char title[20];         /*!< Title */
00324    char language[MAX_LANGUAGE];  /*!< Default language */
00325    char iax2privatekey[20];   /*!< Private key for this user */
00326    char zonetag[80];    /*!< Time zone */
00327    char numuserid[80];     /*!< Numeric user ID for this user */
00328    char pincode[80];    /*!< Numeric pincode for this user */
00329    char secret[80];     /*!< Secret for this user */
00330    char ldapdn[180];    /*!< LDAP DN */
00331    char registrar[20];     /*!< Who added this object? */
00332    char timezone[80];      /*!< Time zone (voicemail.conf) */
00333    char soundname[80];     /*!< File name that includes this users name in audio */
00334    char channelgroup[80];     /*!< Default channelgroup for calls from this user */
00335    ast_group_t callgroup;        /*!< Calling group for calls */
00336    ast_group_t pickupgroup;      /*!< Pickup group */
00337    struct ast_variable *chanvars;   /*!< Default channel variables */
00338    struct aum_presencelist presence;   /*! Presence states */
00339    struct aum_user_contextlist contexts;  /*!< Linked list of contexts this user use */
00340    struct aum_user_grouplist groups;   /*!< Linked list of groups we are members to */
00341    struct aum_user_addrlist address;   /*!< Linked list of addresses of various types */
00342    struct aum_devicelist devices;      /*!< Linked list of devices active for this user */
00343    struct ast_ha  *acl;       /*!< Access control list for user */
00344                   /*!< The highest priority is used as primary group for setting default values */
00345    int manager_read_perm;        /*!< If set, this user can log in to manager with these permissions */
00346    int manager_write_perm;       /*!< If set, this user can log in to manager with these permissions */
00347 };
00348 
00349 /*! \brief the AUM group definition */
00350 struct aum_group {
00351    ASTOBJ_COMPONENTS(struct aum_group);   /*! Generic pointers and name field */
00352    unsigned int flags;        /*!< Flags for various stuff, see AUM_GROUP_FLAG_* */
00353    char sipdomain[120];       /*!< Should be AST_MAX_DOMAIN something */
00354    char incoming_did[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];  /*!< Main DID for this group */
00355    char language[MAX_LANGUAGE];     /*!< Default language for group */
00356    char musicclass[MAX_MUSICCLASS]; /*!< Default musicclass for this group */
00357    ast_group_t callgroup;        /*!< Calling group for calls */
00358    ast_group_t pickupgroup;      /*!< Pickup group */
00359    int manager_read_perm;        /*!< If set, this group can log in to manager with these permissions */
00360    int manager_write_perm;       /*!< If set, this group can log in to manager with these permissions */
00361    struct aum_user_contextlist contexts;  /*!< Linked list of contexts this group use */
00362    struct ast_variable *chanvars;
00363    struct ast_ha  *acl;       /*!< Access control list for user */
00364    char *description;         /*!< Description */
00365    char timezone[80];      /*!< Time zone (voicemail.conf) */
00366    struct aum_user_grouplist members;  /*!< Members list */
00367    char registrar[20];     /*!< Who added this object? */
00368 };

00372 /*! \brief Find AUM user 
00373    \param userid Unique user ID for this user 
00374    \param realtime TRUE forces lookup and loading of realtime users in memory
00375    \return NULL if not found, otherwise pointer to structure 
00376 */
00377 struct aum_user *find_aum_user(char *userid, int realtime);
00378 
00379 /*! \brief Find specific context for user
00380    \param user AUM user object pointer
00381    \param type AUM context type searched for
00382    \result     Context string if found, NULL if not
00383 */
00384 char *find_aum_user_context(struct aum_user *user, enum aum_context_type type);
00385 
00386 /*! \brief Find an address for an AUM user 
00387    \param user AUM user object pointer
00388    \param type AUM address type (enum)
00389    \param start   AUM Address pointer for where to start the search in the linked list. NULL if from beginning
00390    \return     Pointer to AUM address object if found, otherwise NULL 
00391 */
00392 struct aum_address *find_address_for_user(struct aum_user *user, enum aum_address_type type, struct aum_address *start);
00393 
00394 /*! \brief Find address object for specified address
00395    \param user AUM user object pointer
00396    \param type AUM address type (enum aum_address_type)
00397    \param address Address
00398    \return  Pointer to AUM address object if found, otherwise NULL
00399 */
00400 struct aum_address *find_user_address(struct aum_user *user, enum aum_address_type type, char *address);
00401 
00402 /*! \brief Find user by any AUM address type address (xmpp, sip, email, iax2 etc)
00403    \param type AUM address type (enum)
00404    \param address Address as a text string
00405 */
00406 struct aum_user *find_user_by_address(enum aum_address_type type, char *address);
00407 
00408 /*! \brief Find AUM user by e-mail
00409    \param email Email address for this user
00410    \return NULL if not found, otherwise pointer to structure 
00411 */
00412 struct aum_user *find_aum_user_email(char *email);
00413 
00414 /*! \brief Find AUM user by numeric user id
00415    \param numuid Searched numeric user ID
00416    \return NULL if not found, otherwise pointer to structure
00417 */
00418 struct aum_user *find_aum_user_by_numuserid(char *numuserid);
00419 
00420 /*! \brief Find AUM user group by group name 
00421    \param Group name in text
00422    \result struct aum_group pointer to group
00423 */
00424 struct aum_group *find_aum_group_by_name(char *groupname);
00425 
00426 /*! \brief Find out if user belongs to group 
00427    \param user AUM user object
00428    \param group Group name
00429 */
00430 int aum_group_test(struct aum_user *user, char *groupname);
00431 
00432 /*! \brief Find out if user belongs to group by group object
00433    \param user AUM user object
00434    \param group Group name
00435 */
00436 int aum_group_test_full(struct aum_user *user, struct aum_group *group);

00441 */
00442 char *aum_find_email(char *userid);

00448 char *aum_find_email_full(struct aum_user *user);

00454 char *aum_find_xmpp(char *userid);

00460 char *aum_find_xmpp_full(struct aum_user *user);

00467 char *aum_find_address(struct aum_user *user, enum aum_address_type type);

00469 /*! \brief Find a context for a user
00470    \param user AUM struct pointer
00471    \param type AUM context type (enum)
00472    \return character string pointer if context found, NULL if not found

00474 char *aum_find_user_context(struct aum_user *user, enum aum_context_type type);

00476 /*! \brief Find parking context for a user 
00477    \param user AUM user struct pointer
00478 */
00479 #define aum_find_user_parking(user) aum_find_user_context(user, AUM_CONTEXT_PARKING);

00481 /*--------- AUM String handling functions ----------------------*/
00482 /*! \brief Allocate AUM string - remember to deallocate
00483    \param string  Input character string
00484    \param charset aum_string_charset enum
00485    \return  aum_string object
00486 */
00487 aum_string *aum_string_alloc(char *string, enum aum_string_charset charset);
00488 
00489 /*! \brief Convert string, allocate new aum_string object and link it at end of list
00490    \param string  Input aum_string
00491    \param charset aum_string_charset enum
00492    \return  aum_string object
00493 */
00494 aum_string *aum_string_add_charset_variant(aum_string *string, enum aum_string_charset charset);
00495 
00496 /*! \brief Get string in specific character set. If not found, convert to that charset and return string
00497    \param string  Input aum_string
00498    \param charset aum_string_charset enum
00499    \return  character string (char *)
00500 */
00501 char *aum_string_output(aum_string *string, enum aum_string_charset charset);
00502 
00503 /*! \brief Parse character set in front of string, create string
00504    \param string  string optionally with charset in front of string, separated with |
00505    \param defaultcharset   Default character set, if not specified
00506    \return  aum_string object, allocated by this function
00507 */
00508 aum_string *aum_string_add(char *string, enum aum_string_charset defaultcharset);

00510 /*! \brief Destroy all strings beginning with this one */
00511 void aum_string_destroy(aum_string *string);
